oai_dc:dc.dc:title: COPOLYMERIZATION OF ALKYL ALPHA-CHLOROACRYLATES WITH METHYL-METHACRYLATE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: PATHAK, CP
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: resist polymers
radiolysis
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Hexyl alpha-chloroacrylate (HCA) and cyclohexyl alpha-chloroacrylate (CCA) have been copolymerized with methyl methacrylate (MMA) in toluene at 55-degrees-C using azobisiso-butyronitrile (AIBN) as initiator. Copolymer compositions have been determined both by H-1 NMR and elemental analyses. For copolymerization of MMA (M1) with HCA (M2), the reactivity ratios (RR) are r1 = 0.47 +/- 0.19 and r2 = 0.81 +/- 0.51 and with CCA the values are r1 = 0.76 +/- 0.31 and r2 = 2.30 +/- 1.73. Thermal properties of these copolymers have also been investigated.
